Articles.Content: Jebediah in currently scattered in dust form across the mountains near KSC after a "less than pleasant" landing.

Jeb's dead, baby. Tried a "suicide burn" coming in to land on the Mun, turned out to be an accurate description. The pod flew away from the impact site, so I thought, "Hey, maybe Jeb can EVA and land safely" Errr.... no.... Don't know what speed he hit the surface, but a puff of dust, and Jeb's gone. There is a memorial flag planted next to the big flag in front of the launch pad. I have a feeling it may not be the last...
Jeb is in transit from Duna back to Kerbin after planting a flag to complete a contract. Swung by Ike on the way home. Ignored the launch window so he's got a long trip home...
Jeb got stuck in munar orbit... *sigh* again...

Jeb got stuck in munar orbit... *sigh* again...

I know, it's his favorite place to hang, right!? I even heard him telling Bill he was thinking about installing a hot tub...

My Jebster was stranded on Duna for 50 years, I finally rescued him, gave him a few missions to my ISS, and then he died in a catastrophic failure during ascent at about 7km. But, thanks to a certain file in a certain directory (no names to protect the innocent), I brought him back to life, and now he's going back to the ISS and then to Dres.
My jeb is in a deep hole in mun south part after trying to land in a steep crater, he went down and down... I should rescue him one of this days

Preparing his self for his first flight to the Mun. Up till now all of my flights have stayed within LKO. Now that I've got wnoufh funds/parts, it's time to go to the Mun in style. His crew will consist of Bob and Bill, naturally.
After approx. ten years vacation in Inland KSC, my Jeb returned back to Astronaut Complex, now, he is probably playing pool.

my jeb did all the 0.24.2 evas until i used a mobile lab at duna. there where 2 evas for bill and 2 for bob. but jeb was all alone on ike (with 2 empty seats next to him). he's just a BadS for BadS-fuel-tight-missions!

He got on my rescue mission pod wich was supposed to be empty, so I had to kick him out to make room for Erley
He snuck into my probe-operated rescue vessel and I had to kick him out to make room for the bounty.
He climbed aboard my rescue craft designed to save kerbals stranded in orbit.

I'm seeing a trend...Jeb is actually in a long-term module on Minmus (or Ike, I can't remember) because, though I picked someone else for the mission, this game loves to reset your pilot selections.
Jeb's lying face-down on the surface of Ike after scraping his feet on the ground during an EVA flight.
cuuretly at home unemployed cuase my saves got wiped
On board of the KSS (Kerbal Space Ship) Defiant. A space plane on the way to Jool to dive in the lower atmosphere. There he will either come out victorious or will die a fiery death...
Currently in the Communications Module of the Kevin Space Station.

Looking after the "used spaceplane graveyard" at the island. When I tech up, i like to leave a copy of the freshly obsolete craft on the island. Until the yesterday's kraken attack, there was about 20 of them, every single an original. Jeb was intentionally left with no fuel in one of them.
First thing I did was strap a SRB to his command pod and he shortly was obliterated.
With all the survivability mods I have, the (usually) first thing that happens to Jeb in my career mode's is that he dies. But don't worry, he does it in many different ways, so it's always fun.

Mine's on the Moon!

(not the Mun)
On a flyby mission to duna.

With all the survivability mods I have, the (usually) first thing that happens to Jeb in my career mode's is that he dies. But don't worry, he does it in many different ways, so it's always fun.

Ditto. My last Jeb killed lost his life upon reentry into Kerbin at too steep of an angle.

On my current save, he has been relegated to testing new lifters. No unplanned lithobraking yet.

In LEO (low eve orbit)

And he is overwhelmingly glad, that he doesn't have to spend the eternity in a purple hell

I'll pick him up next week.

Edited November 8, 2014 by KerrMÃƒÂ¼
Waiting for a launch window to leave Duna for home. In a parallel universe (where funds have been invented) he's stranded on Minmus awaiting the rescue ship.
Drifting around Sun's orbit ( send rescue mission already)
22 days from leaving Kerbin's SOI. Then he'll go home -- he just wants to take some pictures out there.
